title: ORMs
description: An ORM (Object-Relational Mapping) is a tool that lets you interact with a database using code instead of writing SQL queries manually. ORMs generate the SQL for you, handle migrations, and provide a clean, structured way to work with data. Modern web development often uses ORMs to simplify database access and keep application code consistent and maintainable.

items: Defines your data models in code
Provides a consistent API for reading and writing data

content.text: Common ORMs used in modern web development:

items: Prisma — TypeScript-first ORM for SQL databases
Mongoose — ODM (Object Document Mapper) for MongoDB
Drizzle ORM — Lightweight, SQL-focused, schema-safe ORM

content.text: A model represents a table (SQL) or collection (NoSQL). It defines the shape of your data and the fields each record contains.
This Prisma example defines a User model with four fields.
ORMs let you query data using code instead of SQL. This improves readability and reduces the chance of syntax errors.
This example retrieves all users using Prisma.
Creating new records is simple and uses the ORM's API.
Migrations update your database structure when your models change. ORMs generate migration files automatically, ensuring your database stays in sync with your code.
For example, adding a new field to a model will generate a migration that updates the database table.
